availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Franklin Beadles (Graves County, Kentucky, student and clerk)

body.p: Graves County, Kentucky, student and clerk. Kentucky native. Son of Yancy Beadles and Sally Rozzell Beadles Allen. Stepson of John Allen. Married to Julia A. Bollinger Beadles. Father of George Yancy Beadles. Attended school in Graves County in 1850. Household owned four enslaved persons in Graves County in 1850. Merchant's clerk in Graves County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Graves County in 1860. Household owned an additional three enslaved persons in Graves County in 1860. Merchant's clerk in Graves County in 1862. Clerk in Graves County in 1863.
